label: 高家
本: The Cambridge History of Japan, Volume 4:  Early Modern Japan . Cambridge University Press . 1991
説明文: This post was held in heredetary succession by the heads of certain families who had monopolized the technical details of dealing with the Kyoto court since the time of the Muromachi shogunate.  They were of low rank but commanded high prestige because of their historical association with the court (p. 168).
